alert.note: Alert for Henry; Rock Island; Whiteside (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued April 01 at 5:14AM CDT until April 05 at 3:00AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Quad Cities IA IL has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers in Illinois... Rock River near Joslin affecting Rock Island, Whiteside and Henry IL Counties. .Heavy rainfall has led to rises on the Rock River. Uncertainty with how routed flow will move through the river system remains high. As such a Flood Watch has been issued. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY EVENING TO EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Rock River near Joslin. * WHEN...From Sunday evening to early Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Water affects low lying agricultural land. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:45 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 11.0 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/quadcities. The next statement will be issued this afternoon.
